The governing body of Carroll County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county tax imposed on:
real property that is:
owned by a nonprofit community or civic improvement association or corporation; and
used only for a community, civic, educational, or library purpose, if:
real property on which an improvement is made to an existing structure that is located in a historic district.

A property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection shall be:
the following percentage of the increase that is due to the improvement:
100% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 1st and 2nd taxable years that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax;
80% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 3rd taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax;
60% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 4th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax; and
40% of the increase in the assessment of the real property in the 5th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to the county property tax; and
ended after the 5th taxable year that the improved structure is subject to county property tax.

The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county property tax imposed on:
real property that is:
owned by the Maryland Jaycees Foundation, Incorporated, of Carroll County; and
located at 602 Johahn Drive in Westminster, Maryland; and
real property that is:
leased by the Sykesville Little League, Incorporated;
located east of Obrecht Road in the 5th election district of Carroll County; and
used only by the Sykesville Little League, Incorporated.
A property tax credit granted under paragraph (1)(i) of this subsection shall continue in effect until the property is conveyed.

The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property used as a principal residence and owned by certain classes of individuals, as specified by the governing body of Carroll County, who are at least 65 years old and who are of limited income.

The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on real property that is:
located in designated geographic regions of the county;
owned by specified classes of persons; and
renovated, upgraded, or rehabilitated in accordance with eligibility criteria established by the county.

The governing body of Carroll County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on property on which a person installs environmentally friendly or "green" technologies, including conserving water, incorporating recycled or recyclable materials, and incorporating renewable and energy efficient power generation.

The governing body of Carroll County or of a municipal corporation in Carroll County may grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on that portion of the real property owned by an independent living retirement community that is used as housing units.

If the governing body of Carroll County or of a municipal corporation in Carroll County authorizes a tax credit under this subsection, the full benefit of the tax credit shall be assigned to residents of the independent living retirement community.
